phrasetype.name: Control Panel User Groups
phrasetype.phrase: Can Adjust Currencies<dfn>Grants access to arbitrary adjustment with the currency popup.</dfn>
Charged Content<dfn>This is the maximum number of times users can charge for content in a single post.</dfn>
Show Inaccessible Currencies<dfn>Otherwise only currencies that can be earned or spent will be shown in Displays.</dfn>
Excluded<dfn>This group will be treated as if they can't earn or spend any currencies.</dfn>
Can See Private Currencies
vBCredits Permissions
Can View Any Transaction Log

phrasetype.name: vBCredits Administration
phrasetype.phrase:
Are you sure you want to delete this conversion? The transactions from users purchasing under it will be kept.
({2}: {3})

{4} This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete the currency called '{1}'? All associated events and transactions will be deleted as well. If you want to reverse them first, use the tool in the account manager and then try deleting this currency again.
({2}: {3})

{4} This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete this event? All associated transactions will be deleted as well. If you want to reverse them first, use the tool in the account manager and then try deleting this event again.
({2}: {3})

{4} This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete these events? All associated transactions will be deleted as well. If you want to reverse them first, use the tool in the account manager and then try deleting these events again.
(eventids: {1})

This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete the redemption called '{1}'? The transactions from users redeeming it will be kept.
({2}: {3})

{4} This action cannot be undone.

Are you sure you want to delete this transaction?
({2}: {3})

{4} This action cannot be undone.
Mass Update Users

Actions are specific places throughout your site where currencies can be involved. Each one has a set of properties that determine the available features during each action. To charge or award currencies for an action, you must create an event that defines what should happen. Additional actions can be installed via third party addons as underlying plugins are required.
To indicate "any", nothing needs to be selected. Is that what you wanted?
Show Advanced Options
Change Search

You can sell your currencies for actual money through any of vBulletin's payment processors. Because users can choose just how much they want to buy, you set tiers and prices for each of them. The denominations and processors are up to you, as well as whether the qualifying tier will take effect for the whole amount or allow the lower tiers to account for their portions.

Currencies are the numeric representation of how involved with a site that users are. You can define as many as you want and link them up to third party systems. Together with actions, you can define events for users to earn and spend currencies for virtually anything they do. All movement of currencies can be limited and will be recorded as transactions.

Column<dfn>After creation, this should stay the same even if you change the title later or loss of data may result. If you are manually creating this currency, the column should generally look like the title, except only with lowercase letters and underscores. If this column does not exist on the above table, it will be added.</dfn>
Rounding<dfn>This is the number of decimal points you wish to round this currency to when it is publicly displayed. Internally, the actual amount will still be used in formulas.</dfn>
Maximum Earned<dfn>Users will be unable to exceed this amount earned. Use blank for no maximum.</dfn>
{1} Formula

Import Currency<dfn>The currency wizard has detected these other currencies present on your system. Select them from the list to automatically fill in the technical details, or leave blank and manually define a custom currency.</dfn>
Transfer To<dfn>If enabled, other currencies may be transferred to this one.</dfn>
Limit Period<dfn>Timespan in seconds that the above maximum is enforced. Use blank for all time.</dfn>
Allow negative display
Negative Handling<dfn>How to treat negative amounts that sometimes occur from uncancelable actions and event negation.</dfn>
Reset to 0 when negative
Show 0 but keep negative
Create New Currency
Transfer From<dfn>If enabled, this currency can be transferred to other applicable currencies.</dfn>
Use vBulletin Table Prefix
Privacy Filter<dfn>The ability to see private currencies is a usergroup permission.</dfn>
Show to everyone
Show to self and designated usergroups
Show to designated usergroups
Table<dfn>This must already exist in your database and somehow reference the vBulletin user table as defined below.</dfn>
Currency<dfn>This tool will add any amounts to this currency that users had from these detected currencies. Leave blank to not transfer anything, or fill in the details yourself.</dfn>
Transfer Currency
User Column<dfn>Database column that contains the userid or username as above.</dfn>
Uses User ID<dfn>Otherwise the table will be expected to be joined by username.</dfn>

Relative Value<dfn>This is the overall value of this currency compared to all other currencies. Generally this only matters when determining total assets and transfering between currencies. You should establish at least one currency with a value of 1 as a base against the rest.</dfn>
Days Registered

Combined Currencies<dfn>If none are selected then all currencies will be included. The relative values of each currency will adjust the total. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>
Displayed Currencies<dfn>If none are selected then all currencies will be shown. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>

Displays format and display the current currency information for your users. They are a template based approach which uses hooks instead of manual edits. You can easily select the currencies to include as well as create a special cumulative field. Additional displays can be installed via third party addons as underlying plugins are required.
Earn {1}
Forums<dfn>The specific forums this event occurs. If none are selected then all forums will be applicable. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>
Usergroups<dfn>The specific usergroups this event applies to. If none are selected then all users will be qualified. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>

Events are where you define exactly what happens during an action. You define what usergroups and forums that apply, as well as whether users will earn or spend currency for that action. All actions are recorded as transactions. You can assign multiple events to the same actions and criteria, and the best one will be used according to the situation.

You may modify currency amounts directly or create a simple formula. Both the amounts listed and the formulas work together; the formula values come from what is shown in the results table.

Formulas can include numbers, spaces, and the following: + for Addition, - for Subtraction, * for Multiplication, / for Division,
(subformulas), D for Days Registered, P for Post Count, R for Reputation, I for Infraction Points, [Currency Name] for Specific Currency

See the help text for examples and extended instructions. To simply update currencies, leave the default formulas.
The mass changes made with this tool cannot be undone and are not recorded.
{1} are greater than or equal to
{1} are less than
No Transactions Found
% Section
% Total
Processing Pending Transactions
Processing Users
It is recommended that you update counters now to process the new pending transactions.
You can prune transactions, recalculate past events, or calculate actions from times prior to the existence of those events by selecting the actions and time periods you wish to process.

Redemptions are an easy way to award currency automatically as part of promotions or incentives to visit third party pages. Insert or generate as many single-use codes as you want, or a single master code that you control how long it can be used. Combined with events, you could specify who can use redemptions or how often.
Spend {1}
{1} {2} these transactions, {3}% of {4} {2} site total
Statistics Grouping<dfn>Break down the statistics according to any unique combination of these properties. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>

Transactions are the records of every completed or moderated event that has occurred. They can be accepted or denied, and their messages can be updated. You can select the range of dates to view, and they are always listed moderated first, and then latest first. Statistics will be built according to the subset of transactions you are displaying, and they can be grouped in multiple ways.
Updated {1} transactions{2}.
Transfer
Update Transactions
Update Users

Rebuild Actions<dfn>Specific actions for calculation or pruning. Actions with * cannot calculate beyond their original transactions; they will be retried instead. Ctrl/cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.</dfn>
Target Any Action<dfn>Prune transactions from all actions, otherwise just the selected ones. For major forum resets.</dfn>
Target Any Time<dfn>Prune transactions occurring since the beginning of the forum, otherwise just during the time span. For major forum resets.</dfn>

Process All Pages of Users<dfn>Updating users is server intensive, so by default only the users shown on this page of results are processed at a time. Enable this to process all remaining pages at once. Requires JavaScript.</dfn>

Prune Existing Transactions<dfn>Delete any eligible transactions found with these criteria. You should probably select this when recalculating to avoid doubled transactions, but can be used just for pruning.</dfn>
End Date<dfn>Latest inclusive time to process actions.</dfn>

Here you can directly manipulate the currency amounts for each user on your site. Start by selecting a group of users you wish to see and they will be presented on the next screen as a list of pages. You can then update their amounts all at once, apply formulas for dynamic changes, or recalculate the actions processed for those users from any point in time.
Calculate Events<dfn>This will process events for the selected actions that occurred during this time span and issue new transactions.</dfn>
Reverse Before Delete<dfn>Return associated currencies as if the transactions never happened. Recommended unless you are resetting the currencies with a formula too, such as 0.</dfn>
Start Date<dfn>Earliest inclusive time to process actions.</dfn>
Updated {1} Users. {2}
Label
Moderated
Save Active Status
Showing Transactions {1} to {2} of {3}

phrasetype.name: Plugin System
phrasetype.phrase: vBCredits

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Number of days between each activity action.
Activity Interval
This is what the user has to do to qualify for the activity credit during the activity interval.
Activity Requirement
Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the activity intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.
Activity Reference
When enabled, the positive equivalent value of the reputation being granted will be used as the multiplier, as negative reputation may undesirably deduct credits.
Use Absolute Value when Granting Reputation

This BBCode will be used for designating charged content. Change this to something else to take over the tags from other content hiding plugins. Blank out this setting to disable the charged content functionality, which would expose such content for free.
Charge Content Tag

The currency that will be used for charged content transactions. Make sure corresponding events are set to use this currency as well.

You will need to Rebuild the Post Cache after making changes to either setting to update existing posts.
Charge Content Currency

To ease rounding issues, you can set a number of decimals that the target currency will be rounded up to that adjusts the source currency amounts accordingly when transferring or donating currency. Use 0 for whole number amounts.
Currency Transfer Rounding
Otherwise only when a user actually gets an infraction will it count.
Include Warnings as Infractions
Number of days between each interest action.
Interest Interval
Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the interest intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.
Interest Reference
Otherwise the action will only occur once no matter how many recipients are attached to a single message.
Private Message Action per Recipient
Number of days between each paycheck action.
Paycheck Interval
Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the paycheck intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.
Paycheck Reference
Actions in vBCredits can be individually customized for a range of effects.
Actions

This is the primary usergroup that a user must enter in order to trigger the referral event for their referrer. You can set up usergroup promotions based on post count, registration time, and reputation in order to strengthen the legitimacy of referrals.
Valid Referral Usergroup
Time in seconds that a thread must not receive a new reply before it is considered old.
Defintion of Old Thread
To force specific currency amounts to be available during donation or transfer, specify them here as a comma separated list. Otherwise, users will be able to enter any amount they want.
Currency Transfer Increments
Choose the way that transactions alerts will be sent. User quotas are ignored.
Transaction Alert Method

This user will be used as the sender for any transaction alerts that you have set up. Remove this user to suspend all alerts. To alter or translate this message, use the following links:

[Alert Title] [Alert Body]
Transaction Alert Sender
When enabled, if more than one event per currency applies to a situation, the event with the highest main amount will be used, otherwise all of them will stack.
Use Best Event

All event transactions are automatically processed by the user who belongs to it. If you have a small site, updates might take a long time to appear, so you can use a scheduled task. Enable the task on this page and set it to run as much as you think your server can handle it, as well as how many records to process each time it does with this setting.

Scheduled Task Manager
Scheduled Transaction Processing

Enabling this will cause most transactions to process immediately as they are triggered, instead of waiting for them to be processed by users loading pages. This will greatly increase the amount of work your system needs to be doing. Before enabling, carefully consider the strength of your server, amount of regular traffic, and the number of events you have created. Misjudgments may lead to server instability, however vBCredits is made to work fine without it if you are unsure.
Process Transactions in Realtime
Places a primary button to see your latest transactions on every page. This only works with vBulletin 4
Enable Navbar Tab
Master toggle for all events should you want to temporarily disable the whole system. Does not disable Displays.
Enable Events
When enabled, the content within [QUOTE], [PHP], [HTML], [CODE] will be ignored when calculating text sizes. Whitespace, Markup BBCodes, and Smilies will be ignored regardless.
Exclude Block BBCode from Size Multipliers

Actions which occur for the owners of content when someone else views them could potentially be seen by guests. It is recommended that this is disabled should the owner log out and view their own content.
Allow Guests to Trigger View Actions
The currency page lists the richest users of each currency in the sidebar. This is the number of richest users that will be returned.
Number of Richest Users
When enabled, the number of words in a text will be used for the size multipliers, otherwise it will be the number of characters.
Count Words for Size Multipliers
The number of decimals to show on transaction log entry amounts, which may have confusing rounding.
Transaction Log Decimals
The currency page lists the latest transactions for each user. This is the number of transactions to show before splitting to the next page.
Number of Transactions
vBCredits Action Options
vBCredits Global Options

setting.optioncode: Look here for any settings that might be created after installing new actions.
radio:piped lastvisit|Sign on lastactivity|Some action lastpost|Post
